results.title: Our wheat industry
results.creator_credit: Peter Whitchurch, Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer and Peter Whitchurch Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Advance Australia”.
A survey of the Australian wheat industry, its early history and its importance to the national economy. Shows the early attempts by Farrer to produce a rust-resistant wheat; the type of wheat developed by Farrer for cultivation in the dry inland areas; the importance and extent of the present day wheat industry; problems confronting the wheat farmer; transport and storage of wheat; the manufacture of flour.

results.title: Our story in stamps
results.brief_description: The production of Malayan postage stamps in Britain. Working from a basic design selected in Malaya, British craftsmen prepare and print the perforated sheets of stamps. Intricate printing processes and skilled workmanship go into their creation. Locale sequences in Malaya reveal the relationships between the symbolic designs on the stamps and the landscape, industries and crafts of the country.

results.title: Our soil resources (formation and conservation)
results.brief_description: Both animation and direct photography are used to demonstrate how soil is formed, the factors which determine the formation of various soil zones, and the measures which can be employed to conserve and control and utilise soil.
results.description: Both animation and direct photography are used to demonstrate how soil is formed, the factors which determine the formation of various soil zones, and the measures which can be employed to conserve and control and utilise soil.

results.title: Our school
results.creator_credit: John Krish, Leon Clore, Graphic Films and National Union of Teachers
results.brief_description: Tells the story of one day in the life of one secondary modern school, the Francis Combe School at Watford in Hertfordshire. Scenes of traditional bookwork, handicrafts, a visit to a local industry, give an impression of the kind of education which the best of these schools provide. Comments on the aims of the school, and some of the problems of the children and teachers.

results.title: Our puppets
results.creator_credit: Geoff Russell and Video Education Australasia
results.brief_description: This short, fun program aims to inspire Years 6-10 Drama and Art students to explore the creative potential of puppet making and performance. It follows an energetic group of Year 7-9 students as they plan, design, construct and present their ambitious but highly successful puppet show. The program features interviews with the students and their teacher as they explore this creative medium.

results.title: Our productive industry
results.creator_credit: Pat Dowling and Pat Dowling Pictures
results.brief_description: Explains that the modern system of mass production and transportation provides large quantities of industrial products for consumers. Stresses the inter-dependence of various industries. Compares old water-powered mills and modern power sources. Shows the first mass produced musket and one of the earliest automobiles in operation.
results.description: Explains that the modern system of mass production and transportation provides large quantities of industrial products for consumers. results.title: Our Prime Minister
results.creator_credit: Ezra Mir and Films Division, Government of India
results.brief_description: A compilation of newsreel footage on the life of Nehru, late Prime Minister of India, who was known all over the world as a symbol of the blending of old and new India. Under his guidance, the country was transformed, and although holding great power he was always accessible to all people. He visited all parts of India and many countries of the world; in turn Delhi became a meeting place for world leaders due to Nehru’s dynamic foreign policy and his belief in the goal of a peaceful world. A portrait of a man of charm, simple tastes and fine intellect who led India in times of strife and in a manner which earned the love and respect of millions.

results.title: Our original inhabitants
results.creator_credit: Jagat Murari, M. Bhavnani and Documentary Films of India
results.brief_description: The original inhabitants of India number some 25 million and belong to 172 groups spread over the sub-continent. The culture, dress, dance and music of the Gonds, Santhals, Todas, Bhils and the Nagas are amongst the tribes mentioned.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Jagat Murari, M. Bhavnani and Documentary Films of India

results.title: Our neighbour Nepal
results.brief_description: Nepal, homeland of the Gurkha soldiers. Its people and rulers, customs, homes, palaces, religious shrines and temples; the King and government; the Ranas, a ruling clique; the disturbances of 1950 and the King’s flight to India; his return and the subsequent visit of Nehru to Katmandu.

results.title: Our native shore
results.creator_credit: Ronald Stark, Andrew Rice, British Information Services and Esso Film Unit
results.brief_description: Shows the people whose lives and work are centred directly on the coastal areas of the British Isles and to whom the sea and ships are a part of their lives. Fisherman, coast guard, merchant seaman, life boat man, harbourmaster, shipwright, yachtsman, lighthouse keeper and a score of others move against a background rich in natural beauty and historical associations.
